text: Imma psoricopa is a moth in the family Immidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1906. It is found in Sri Lanka.Imma at funet.fi. The wingspan is 17–20 mm. The forewings are light ochreous-fuscous, suffusedly strigulated throughout with dark fuscous and with small obscure whitish-ochreous spots on the costa beyond the middle and before the apex. There is an ochreous-whitish discal dot at three-fifths, followed by a dark fuscous dot. The hindwings are rather dark grey.Trans. Ent. Soc. Lond. 1906 (2): 176 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1906 Category:Immidae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Imma psoricopa
